resources.string: Storage, Memory and OOP Quiz
High Score: 0
What is inheritance in object-oriented programming?
Allows classes to inherit commonly used state and behavior from other classes
What is an object in object-oriented programming?
A software bundle of related state and behavior
What is a class in object-oriented programming?
A blueprint from which individual objects are created
What is encapsulation?
The wrapping up of data under a single unit; mechanism that binds code and the data it manipulates
What is object-oriented programming?
A type of computer programming (software design) in which programmers define the data type of a data structure and also the functions that can be applied to it
What is a memory cell?
The fundamental building block of computer memory
What is flash storage?
A solid-state non-volatile memory medium that can be erased and reprogrammed
What is modularity in computer science?
Each piece or module contains everything necessary to execute one aspect of desired functionality
When is recursion useful?
When the problem can be broken down into smaller, repetitive problems
What is NOR flash primarily used for?
Used for code execution because of its fast read times
What is NAND flash primarily used for?
Used for mass storage devices including SSDs
What is method overloading?
Allows different methods to have the same name, but different signatures where the signature can differ by the number of input parameters or type of input parameters or both
What is overriding?
A feature that allows a subclass or child class to provide a specific implementation of a method that is already provided by one of its super-classes or parent classes
What is polymorphism?
Allows you to define one interface and have multiple implementations
What is an interface?
Specifies what a class must do, but not how
